Reviews: I used Cicalfate during radiation treatments, and it seems to have done an excellent job of keeping my skin from getting too red or blistering. Because the radiation oncologist was concerned about residue on the skin that might interfere with the treatment, I would apply it twice a day, after treatment, and would wash it off gently with Basis soap before treatment. I don't have anything to compare it to, so this is far from a scientific finding, but I did get considerably more skin damage to an area I was not applying Cicalfate to (admittedly a more sensitive area--impossible to know how it would have fared with the Cicalfate). ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 300ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I was skeptical. It is water. It is not a laser. It is not a high priced cream formulated by a trendy dermatologist. What is water going to do? Golly, was I proven wrong! I have much sun damage from being a child growing up in the late 70s and early 80s in California. Sunscreen? What's that? "Pass the Ban De Soliel for the Sun" as the commercials went. In the late 80s and early 90s I was a swimmer. I discovered sunscreen, but then became a distance swimmer. You can't exactly stop and reapply sunscreen in the middle of an ocean swim or you get disqualified if you touch the boat. I was young and stupid and about sun protection. I have a lot of sun damage from being young and stupid. Now as a cancer survivor I have a few large slit scars from surgery. The one on my neck from my thyroidectomy REALLY bothers me. This water is healing my skin!!! Again, it is just the thermal mineral and prebiotic water. It is miraculous! My skepticism was proven out the window! It is healing my sun damage. It is lessening the appearance of and softening my surgical scars. It is a God send for eczema flares and otherwise irritated or angry skin. How did I make it into my mid forties never hearing or this product or using it before? If you were skeptical like me, give it a go. You'll never be more pleased you were proven wrong. This is not only a "game changer" as some over say it is a watery miracle. Now I believe the people who go to the destinations for the healing waters. I'm saving up for trip to the Avene spa myself. It is safe for we of the supersensitive skin. It is safe for we cancer patients. Check with your doctor before hand/I am not a doctor nor doling out medical advice but I would spray this on a radiation burn zebra stripe without hesitating. Same with a sun burn. It is the ONLY thing now I used during an eczema flare up or summer mosquito bite. To summarize: I'm a former skeptic now preaching this product.

I use in combination with the Cleanance Hydra soothing face wash and thermal spring water toner spray. The scent of the products are amazing too! ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 300ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Av√®ne Thermal Spring Water is a mist that provides soothing, softening benefits for sensitive, hypersensitive and allergic skin. Like most people, I was pretty sceptical about this and thought it was simply expensive water in can. The nozzle and pressure of the can provides a good volume of mist and coverage, and is easy to use on the face or all over the body. The thermal spring water has been refreshing and soothing, especially on days when my skin is dry, red or irritated. I have noticed that after using the spray, it provides a nice soothing feeling, calms down the redness and irritation on the skin, and a nice hydration boost before moisturising to lock that moisture. It is really easy to use, simply point the nozzle and spray, giving a bit of time and pat down to dry. This product is multipurpose and great to leave in the fridge for a cool refreshing spritz especially on a hot day or to help sooth any irritation or redness. Though it is pretty expensive to simply use as a cooling mist. I do like the soothing effects, minimising irritation and redness, as well as the hydration boost before moisturising.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 300ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Before testing this product out, I was kept sceptical. It's almost an all-purpose skin spray; I used it before applying makeup and also on my dry skin. It's added hydration to my skin and is very soothing I would also say I was surprised by how big the 300mL was. ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 300ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this refreshing spray! I guess it's hard to write a review and the number one thing that people wonder is "do I need this?" There are just so many uses and I particularly loved the tip of popping it in the fridge for a cold mist. I must say, I particularly loved it after a beach visit to freshen up and prevent my face going crusty or salty from the beach! I love it as a base/first step for skincare as I find products get absorbed better when there is a little premoisture/hydration. I love it to refresh my makeup-spray a little at the end of the day and you feel fresher. Dab away any extra moisture and oil and you'll look as good as new! Whilst this product isn't an "essential" like say, an SPF or moisturiser, I think it is an essential in that once you have it you'll wonder how you did without it.

ProductName: Avene Cicalfate+ Restorative Protective Cream 100ml - Multi-purpose Repair cream
Reviews: I used Cicalfate during radiation treatments, and it seems to have done an excellent job of keeping my skin from getting too red or blistering. Because the radiation oncologist was concerned about residue on the skin that might interfere with the treatment, I would apply it twice a day, after treatment, and would wash it off gently with Basis soap before treatment. I don't have anything to compare it to, so this is far from a scientific finding, but I did get considerably more skin damage to an area I was not applying Cicalfate to (admittedly a more sensitive area--impossible to know how it would have fared with the Cicalfate). The radiation oncologist was impressed at how well my skin held up over the course of treatment, so all indications are that it is very effective in protecting the skin from the worst effects of radiation.

Reviews: I used Cicalfate during radiation treatments, and it seems to have done an excellent job of keeping my skin from getting too red or blistering. Because the radiation oncologist was concerned about residue on the skin that might interfere with the treatment, I would apply it twice a day, after treatment, and would wash it off gently with Basis soap before treatment. I don't have anything to compare it to, so this is far from a scientific finding, but I did get considerably more skin damage to an area I was not applying Cicalfate to (admittedly a more sensitive area--impossible to know how it would have fared with the Cicalfate). The radiation oncologist was impressed at how well my skin held up over the course of treatment, so all indications are that it is very effective in protecting the skin from the worst effects of radiation.

Reviews: I‚Äôm completely annoyed. This is actually a great cream if you have very dry skin or are using a retinoid. It helps seal in the moisture loss. HOWEVER, it needs to be reformulated so that it can actually be shipped in cold weather months. I received my first bottle in mid December and it was completely separated; meaning the lotion was separated from the spring water in the formula. Is it still usable? Kinda. You have to squeeze all of the water out BEFORE the cream comes out and it‚Äôs a mess. Because all of the water squirts out, you‚Äôre literally throwing money down the drain!! This stuff is expensive. I‚Äôm not ok with that. I asked for a replacement. They gave me a replacement and it came the exact same way! It‚Äôs unusable to me and I‚Äôm throwing money down the drain. I‚Äôm now going to ask for a refund. Maybe it won‚Äôt separate in the warmer months? And if anyone from Avene is looking at this review, the heat pack obviously doesn‚Äôt work and is a waste.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I first begun using the Eau Thermale Av√®ne Thermal Spring Water in the warmer months as part of my daily skincare routine and then throughout the day to hydrate and refresh my skin, now I use it daily all year round as I love it so much. It is so cooling, soothing and refreshing it really helps wakes my skin up with each pass over my skin. The great thing is that it also comes in a range of sizes so I have one wherever I am, I have the largest sized bottle (300ml) in my bedroom at home and the smaller version (50ml or 150ml) in my handbag so that I have it with me all day everyday. I recommend this to anyone and everyone and have got so many people onto using it.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: Great product,  I use large size regularly and purchased for easy transportation in handbag when needed.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I love the Avene Thermal range! This Avene Thermal Spring Water is a staple in my bathroom.  I have been using it for 4 years now after suffering sensitive skin from Rosacea.  I use it to cool down my face in over heated environments, as a final toner after cleansing and also to prep my skin for moisturiser application.  The soothing property of the spring water really does settle the redness of my skin and any inflammatory irritation that occurs from the environment.  The fact that the can comes in various sizes means I can also bring one on the go with me.  The travel size is small enough to bring traveling or to the gym! I would highly recommend this product and in my opinion the price range is a good value if you need a soothing application.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At first I wasn't that fussed about trying this product (thinking this was just a face freshener that people used on long-haul flights!) however I was totally blown away by the results.  My current skin is midway through second pregnancy - which means a mixture of break outs and dry patches which really hurt.  I found the spring water to be the perfect product to put on my skin post washing my face, it was instantly cooling and hydrating.  It didn't seem to aggravate the dry patches and I didn't notice an increase in pimples.  It was also really easy to put my serum, moisturiser etc ontop. Would definitely get again!

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was surprised at how quickly this product helped ease my skin irritation following a flare up of eczema and contact dermatitis on both my face and my body. The extra boost of cooling moisture helped reduce the dryness and irritation. I would definitely recommend this product for anyone looking for a cooling spray for warmer months

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Av√®ne Thermal Spring Water is a mist that provides soothing, softening benefits for sensitive, hypersensitive and allergic skin. Like most people, I was pretty sceptical about this and thought it was simply expensive water in can. The nozzle and pressure of the can provides a good volume of mist and coverage, and is easy to use on the face or all over the body. The thermal spring water has been refreshing and soothing, especially on days when my skin is dry, red or irritated. I have noticed that after using the spray, it provides a nice soothing feeling, calms down the redness and irritation on the skin, and a nice hydration boost before moisturising to lock that moisture. It is really easy to use, simply point the nozzle and spray, giving a bit of time and pat down to dry. This product is multipurpose and great to leave in the fridge for a cool refreshing spritz especially on a hot day or to help sooth any irritation or redness. Though it is pretty expensive to simply use as a cooling mist. I do like the soothing effects, minimising irritation and redness, as well as the hydration boost before moisturising.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Before testing this product out, I was kept sceptical. However, as someone who suffers from dry skin and eczema, I was pleasantly surprised with the results this spring water provided. It's almost an all-purpose skin spray; I used it before applying makeup and also on my dry skin. It's added hydration to my skin and is very soothing I would also say I was surprised by how big the 300mL was. I would, however, repurchase the smaller bottle just to keep in my handbag to refresh my face.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This spray was really easy and refreshing to use. The spring water comes out as a fine mist which was very cooling especially on hot days.I normally do suffer from dry skin and I felt that it did help to put the moisture back especially in the dry areas of my face.The 300mL bottle was a bit big to carry around but I do know it does come in the smaller sizes which would be handy to pop into my handbag.Overall I would recommend this product to everyone especially coming into the summer months where this would be a nice refreshing spray

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such a great product and I'm so glad to have come across this. It's helped me so much especially with my dry sensitive skin, as it feels more hydrated, soothing and gives that added youthful healthy-looking glow after a couple of uses. Also, it has relived and lessened the visibility of skin irritation too. Now I've added it to my daily skin routine and have never looked back. Highly recommend this product.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been curious about Av√®ne Thermal Spring Water for a while now but was skeptical of it's claims as it seemed like just water in a can. So I was pleasantly surprised by how it calmed down my dry patches and eczema. The mist is very fine and adds a luxurious boost of hydration to the skin. It it light and refreshing enough that it doesn't feel like it is weighing down my skin as the weather warms up.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Coming into summer I am so excited to use this. I have incorporated it into my every day routine from morning to night - it's great to spray over your face to wake up in the morning before applying serums and moisturisers, can be used throughout the day to refresh dull, dry looking make up without it shifting or sliding off, and before bed for a lasting hit of hydration before applying heavier creams.I also kept this in the fridge and used it on almost sunburnt skin and found it so hydrating and non sticky (unlike moisturisers/aloe gel).

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The effects of this spray has really surprised me ‚Äì it‚Äôs so soothing and refreshing, and really helps hydrate my otherwise dry and sensitive face. The redness on my face seemingly disappears too, which really helps as the days get warmer and I find myself out under the sun more often. I highly recommend this product to anyone with sensitive skin like mine, that could use a hydration boost and refreshing pick me up.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this refreshing spray! I guess it's hard to write a review and the number one thing that people wonder is "do I need this?" And if you're even considering buying this, I'm going to say yes and here's why...It's so versatile and refreshing!!!! There are just so many uses and I particularly loved the tip of popping it in the fridge for a cold mist. I must say, I particularly loved it after a beach visit to freshen up and prevent my face going crusty or salty from the beach! I love it as a base/first step for skincare as I find products get absorbed better when there is a little premoisture/hydration. I love it to refresh my makeup-spray a little at the end of the day and you feel fresher. Dab away any extra moisture and oil and you'll look as good as new! Whilst this product isn't an "essential" like say, an SPF or moisturiser, I think it is an essential in that once you have it you'll wonder how you did without it.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] SUCH a refreshing product. I've used this for many years and can't say how much I love it enough... especially during the Summer months! Love spraying this across my whole body when it's super hot and humid for a quick refreshing hit.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This water spray really surprised me! It was super hydrating and calming. I love to use this morning and night after cleansing for a smooth hydrated base before I apply my other skincare products. My sensitive skin had a reaction to another product, and after spraying this I definitely saw a visible improvement in the irritation and the redness completely went away. The spray is so refreshing, I love having this bottle on my bedside table to really wake me up in the morning or spray during the night to cool down. I can already tell this is going to be a staple for me in summer. Although the bottle is quite large, it‚Äôs easy to hold and use and you get a lot of product! The mist feels amazing and distributes the product perfectly across the face. This is definitely a product for people who want to treat themselves and add a luxurious extra step to their skincare routine!

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product does exactly what it sets out to do- hydrate and revitalise. Whilst trying out this product I tried it in a variety of ways:1. I have quite dry skin especially on my legs and in particular my shins. Applying this added moisture back and especially after going to the beach and being that bit salty! Great for summer!2. When applying make up it generally looks great straight away but can look a bit dried out- applying this added more of a glossy look and refreshed my make up.Overall I would definitely recommend this product.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product is such a skincare staple!I always use this as a 'spritz' after cleansing, and before applying my serums (for added hydration). If I'm going to the beach, I also bring this along for an added hydrating spritz in summer. It's even more cooling if you store it in the fridge.I like the big bottle for home usage, the mini bottles are good for 'travel'. I didn't necessarily see any reduction in 'redness', however my usage of this product is primarily to 'refresh' the face and skin. I recommend this product for everyone of all ages.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I surprisingly enjoyed trialling Av√®ne‚Äôs Thermal Spring Water product. I have never used a mist such as this one before and found it very convenient on the go, especially after a run or exercising. It immediately soothes irritation and softens skin. The spray bottle is so convenient to use and I didn‚Äôt actually find the need to pat dry after a few minutes as it easily absorbed into skin. It can also be used throughout the day over makeup and doesn‚Äôt let it slide away. Would overall recommend this product.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: This is one of my must-have products. I have oily and sensitive skin that can flare up due to allergens in the air. Spritzing this on instantly calms my skin and is very soothing. I use this primarily as a toner after cleanser and before applying serum. I find this helps to prevent any flare ups, especially in spring during hayfever season. This is also great for travel and in the office when the air is quite dry. A single pump really helps to inject moisture back into the skin. The spray is a very fine mist that distributes evenly without dripping. I have a large can in the bathroom and the smaller travel-sized version in my bag. It might seem odd paying for water, but I find this really does have the soothing benefits and worth the money.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: Lovely product, makes my skin feel so soft

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: Love it it‚Äôs just perfect

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I've been using this Thermal Spring Water for about a year now and love how refreshing it makes my skin feel, especially during those hot, sticky summer days.  The mist is so fine and only a short spritz or two is needed to cover my face.  I use the spray after showering each day and before applying my skincare products, and I find it fabulous for cooling down my face after a workout.  It has in the past relieved and healed the redness on my face after experiencing a reaction to some product I had used.  During the warmer months I use the spray at any time to refresh my skin.  I suppose it's just water in a can with added benefits but no matter what it is it is certainly soothing and comforting and makes my skin feel so refreshed.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin

I have been using it every day since and feel my face feels and looks alot better. Its good also that my face never stings when I spray it on. So it would be good for peoples faces that are sensitive. Avene Thermal Spring water has become a product that I use in my beauty regime everyday and I couldnt be more impressed

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Refreshing and hydrating all in one relaxing mist. ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Avene Thermal Sping Water Spray is perfect for summer! It's nice and cool on the skin and super refreshing. My face feels hydrated after, but isn't sticky at all. The spray has a good pressure, is easy to control and is not overpowering. Although this product is great, I haven't noticed any differences, nor has there hasn't been any visible changes to my skin. The price of the product is reasonable, and I would purchase it again for the summer!

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lovely product that I use over the cooler months. I have this on my desk and use it all day long. The mist is fine and the nozzle sprays  well. I'm not sure if it actually does anything for my skin though? It would be difficult to see visible results. I also like to use it before I apply oil so my face is slightly damp. I mainly use it to cool down. But I don't think I would use this purely for skin care benefits

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a refreshing moisture boost, and very convenient to use. I use it through the day, after I have a cleaned my face and it does the job for me. Really good to use after you have come in from the sun! Its cooling and refreshing. It takes a while to evaporate from the skin, but one can get around that by not spraying on too much. I have combination skin that is prone to rashes. I find this product moisturizing and soothing.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I have gone through this about 4 times, and it adds moisture to your face before you apply moisturiser to your face. I used this in cohesion to the other Avene products and it has reduced redness and cleared some of my blemishes. You have to wait about a month until you actually see results though.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I had a smilar response to one of the other punters here, to the effect of "why bother?" Other facial spray mists I have used (hello old skool Jurlique) had helpful botanicals. My sample size was small and obviously wouldn't last long. In some ways I had no need to use it, in other ways its actual replacement cost was so exxy I felt obliged to save it for an occasion. For some reason I didn't use it in association with cycling, and can't recall why. I ended up in a super poorly insulated rental property, in a sweltering summer. The heat was murderous. I was using the more economical version of this, a generic plastic spray bottle with tap water. (I don't think I tried spring water).Eventually I remembered this sample, and have to admit in that context, compared to  squirting myself with a standard spray bottle, this was by contrast glorious. It's not just in the water, it's in the spray mist applicator. This delivers a very fine, cool, even, precise mist.  It doesn't turn you into a drowned rat with damp hair, and with water and possibly make up dripping off your face. It also got used up quite quickly. Sample size was possibly smaller than 50ml. At that time, the full priced larger cannisters seemed to be about $20 at CW which was out of the question. There was no way to refill the one I had. This is unlike the Jurlique reusable packaging, although the spray applicator's mist quality is superior. I'm not especially convinced the water has super special qualities. But like most spring water, it is pleasant relative to mains tap water.So, for people who may be trapped in hot buildings, cars or environments without air conditioning, people engaging in aerobic activities that induce sweating like cycling, and possibly for those experiencing conditions such as hot flushes, I think this spray could be useful. Therefore i recommend keeping an eye out for specials, including where it is supplied as a bonus extra to trial. It's a great product because of the fineness of the spray, it's just difficult to justify covering the full retail cost on a budget, and as it's worth having in your arsenel, pick it up as a bargain if you can.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 50ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I don‚Äôt see how this product has any benefit, used it without any noticeable effect, haven‚Äôt tried any more av√®ne products

I never use a full pump. It‚Äôs more like a half pump so a little goes a long way. My skin is left feeling super clean, refreshed, super soft, super moisturized, and CALM. It‚Äôs how I prep my skin every night before my Tretinoin skincare routine as well as when I use my AHA/BHA serums and other skincare + makeup in the day. I am truly surprised and happy with this purchase and will continue to purchase this cleanser in the future. I love it so much I have recommended it to my mother and sisters. Reviews: I have used the skin recovery cream for over two years after a major skin freak out. The texture of the prior dream was light, but effective and almost acted like a primer under my make up.it was discontinued so I tried this cream which is the replacement. Immediately I noticed the texture was thicker, almost pasty, and harder the spread. It felt heavier and I noticed pilling as I applied my makeup and it seemed to magnify my pores. For reference, I am 66, used to have combo skin, but it is now dry and sensitive. I have used several Avene products over the last couple of years, but this one is a disappointment. I see they have added beeswax, so maybe that is responsible for the thick texture and pilling. I also had a few pimples after using. Sorry, Avene, but this change was a fail.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance CONTROL Soothing Skin Recovery Cream 40ml - Moisturiser for hypersensitive skin

I let my skin calm down and tried again in case it was a fluke - nope! The second time was worse. Needless to say, Avene has lost my business. Sad, as I really did love the Skin Recovery Cream.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance CONTROL Soothing Skin Recovery Cream 40ml - Moisturiser for hypersensitive skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Emulsion Face SPF 50+ 50ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Firstly, I have to say I am so glad that there's a lot more choice of high protection sunscreen now and that sunscreens with an SPF50 + are the norm. Of course there is a lot of variation in quality and texture also, but Eau Thermale Avene is well-known for their skincare, so I was happy to try this emulsion when I first saw it. I was looking for good coverage with a matte consistency to wear under make-up and no white caste.  The sunscreen has a pump applicator, is light and easy to apply and covers my whole face and neck with one quick application. It gives a nice matte, non-shiny appearance and goes so nicely under make-up. It does unfortunately show a very light white caste but this can easily be blended in. The  scent is  quite mild, rather like skincare, which is another plus for me. Avene do make it easy to incorporate sunscreen into your skin routine. The slight white caste that requires more blending is the only drawback, and I do prefer Avene's  Tinted Cream for this reason - hence only 4 stars. Still a good product I will repurchase.

Reviews: I have sensitive skin so have been searching for a gentle physical sunscreen for daily use. While it does the job and works well (I have sensitive skin that has reacted to a lot of sunscreens in the past), I won't be using this daily as it leaves a white cast which I'm ok with using at the beach etc, but not on a daily basis.

Reviews: I am so happy to have found this suncream. Not greasy. Goes under or over make up. Love it.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Emulsion Face SPF 50+ 50ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I had high expectations of this face sunscreen as it was from a reputable french brand. It contains a mix of physical (titanium dioxide) and chemical filters (Octocylene, Methylene Bis-Benzotriazolyl, Tetramethylbutylphenol). and water resistance of 40 minutes. I have a light skin tone and it looks ok on me even though I can tell that there is a slight white cast. This may be a problem for darker skin tones.It does have quite a strong fragrance that reminds me of the Nivea's Shine Control face sunscreen. The texture is light and non-greasy, and it absorbs and dries down quite well. It doesn't cause make-up to pull. However, I find that it does have a slight stickiness to it and in the middle of a hot day, my face does become oily.It's not the most elegant face sunscreen that I've used. There are better and cheaper face sunscreens like Cancer Council matte or Natio Daily defence that are made in Australia. Not a repurchase for me.

ProductName: Avene Cleansing Foam 150ml
Reviews: This super easy-to-use cleansing foam is another staple from the Eau Thermale range. It rinses off so easily but without that  squeaky clean feeling that you just know will leave your skin dry and taut. Unusually, it actually lives up to its claim to be safe for use on eye makeup - I have rarely found this even in dedicated eye makeup removers, but it is absolutely true. I would still double cleanse heavy makeup ( a hard habit to break) but for ordinary days it does the trick, and I would recommend this to most skin types except very dry.Nice to have a product that can keep most of the family happy!

ProductName: Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser 200ml - Cleanser for hypersensitive skin
Reviews: My skin is extremely reactive lately. I am acne-prone and my dermatologist has me on a benzoyl peroxide/clindamycin topical in the morning and a tretinoin topical at night. This combination (particularly in the mornings) can cause a lot of stinging, burning, itching, and discomfort after cleansing and applying the topical, and that's before I apply my moisturizer. I have to use moisturizer due to the drying nature of the medications, and I absolutely must use sunscreen. The problem has been that IT HURTS! I've only used this cleanser twice so far, once last night prior to my tretinoin, and once this morning prior to my bzp/clin topical. So far, I am IN LOVE! The morning medication didn't burn and make me want to rip my skin off. The real moment of truth was the moisturizer, though. I'm using the tolerance balm and I was prepared for my usual extreme discomfort, but guess what? NOTHING! It doesn't burn, itch, sting, or hurt. My face feels moisturized and comfortable. I am so thrilled I found this skincare line by total accident. I love my Cetaphil, but even that hasn't cut it with these topical medications. Maybe now I'll actually keep up on the daily routine with my topicals since I don't have to choose between painful, clearer skin and a face riddled with breakouts.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser 200ml - Cleanser for hypersensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After a nasty skin flare-up on my face, neck and chest (caused, perhaps, by the use of retinol), I decided to go right back to basics and, after a little research, decided on Avene, which is infused with spring water and has a good reputation for dealing with skin sensitivities. I use the Tolerance Extreme Cleansing Lotion (gently massaging into the skin with my fingers) and remove it with a pad soaked in Avene Thermal Spring Water; I then spray my entire face, neck and chest with the Spring Water and, when that has soaked in, I use Avene Tolerance Extreme Creme Riche for my moisturising step. Over the past couple of weeks, having stopped my usual serums etc and having used only Avene products, my skin is now looking much better and feels calm, soothed and moisturised. Although I will, no doubt, gradually want to return to using some of the more active products I was using before the flare-up, I'm very happy now with my skin and intend to continue using the Avene cleansing, toning and moisturising steps as part of my regular skincare routine.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser 200ml - Cleanser for hypersensitive skin
Reviews: I completely lost my capacity to generate tears thirty-six years ago, and finding skincare not irritating to my eyes has been a challenge. Avene products are perfect for me, and this particular cleanser is a godsend.Don‚Äôt hesitate with this one.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser 200ml - Cleanser for hypersensitive skin
Reviews: From what I can tell this is a re-packaging of Avene's old Extremely Gentle Cleansing milk that came in a transparent bottle with a flip top. It is a viscous skim-milk type consistency and the new bottle is more appealing & securely closes.It gives the same super gentle cleansing -- never burns eyes or leaves a greasy film, has no smell or anything irritating. I sometimes wear tinted SPF but otherwise wear no make-up so I can only attest to its efficacy in removing tinted SPF: it takes a couple of applications. I apply this cleanser with my fingertips & massage in for one minute then rinse off with a wet pima cotton flannel face cloth that is super gentle & I have no problems with this method: no redness, no nothing. It's not an exciting cleanser but it checks all my boxes: no fragrance, no essential oils, wipe off, etc.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser 200ml - Cleanser for hypersensitive skin
Reviews: The cleanser really does calm my skin. I was recently diagnosed with Seborrheic dermatitis & it is the only thing that does not sting when cleansing my skin.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser 200ml - Cleanser for hypersensitive skin
Reviews: I have very sensitive skin that is also dealing with acne. Usually, I get dried out when I wash my face but then massively break out if I don't, so I tried this since it is gentle and no-rinse. So far my face likes it for the sensitivity and its way less drying. I am still getting some breakouts but not as bad. I also don't turn bright red or burn when I use it, so that's super nice. give it a 4 because it's a keeper but I am also not like 'OMG MY FACE IS AMAZING!' To me that would be a 5. :) I wish there were more instructions on the bottle, though. I am unsure if I'm supposed to wipe away the cream to clean or just massage it in and leave it to clean? I've been doing both with equal results, just wish I had a bit more info on the bottle.

Reviews: I am not usually a huge fan of milk/lotion cleansers, however, I was pleasantly surprised at how much I ended up loving this cleanser! I also love that it does not leave any residue after cleansing, which is what I usually dislike about milk/lotion cleansers. I would easily recommend this to anyone, especially to those looking for a gentle, effective lotion cleanser and those with sensitive skin types.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: I decided after Accutane to branch out and get some new skincare products since your skin starts becoming a bit more oily after coming off the medication. I bought the cleanser, and the blemish control serum to see how my skin gets on with them. About a month after stopping my medication I started using these products. So far my skin LOVES them, for those of you who don't know Accutane is a strong acne medication that makes your skin EXTREMELY sensitive. However, this serum did not irritate my skin what so ever and it is quite remarkable considering I was one-month post-Accutane 60/80g. This serum helped control my oil without drying out my whole face, and although it is not meant to treat pimples it did help some underskin ones. The packaging is great for traveling and the pump is nice. I think all of their products look great, and if anyone is concerned about skin tolerance this product does not feel acid-like, unlike other products. Overall, I think it is worth a try for anyone with acne and I can see this totally being used in combination with other acne medication because it is not irritating.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: Had to drop in and leave a 5 star review because I'm amazed by the results. I'm 28 and have oily, acne-prone skin and I get hormonal acne around my chin and jawline, so I've tried my fair share of acne products. I initially bought this because of the affordable price, and now that I'm using it I must say I am thoroughly impressed with this serum. I apply it 2 to 3 times a day after cleansing with the la roche-posay effaclar cleanser. It worked overnight to reduce my cystic acne and whiteheads. After the first night I tried it, I woke up the next morning and felt my chin and was shocked that I didn't feel any bumps. Treating acne takes patience, and this serum works so quickly, effectively, and reliably for me that it takes the stress out of the process. I typically use it all over my face, but I use it as a spot treatment, too. Plus it's much more affordable than the spot treatments I've been using. I will definitely be repurchasing this.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: It was a pleasure to have had a chance to recieve a sample of Cleanance Concentrate Blemish Control Serum. It definitely came in handy at a time when I was struggling and breaking out with mild blemishes and acne. I know, I know, I'm in my thirties, but it sometimes still happens. Anyways, I have tried so many different treatments and products and none had been really effective or they either irritated my dry sensitive skin, making it worse. Well, I have been using this small size sample at night right before bedtime, and I'm really surprised with how effective and gentle it is! I was able to actually see a difference in the redness from my blemishes and acne actually being reduced and improving! This serum makes my face feel smoother, softer, and look healthier with a radiant glow! The only downside is that it has a strong medicinal scent, but it dissipates quickly after rubbing it into your skin. I like how it doesn't have any harsh chemicals, doesn't burn, it has plant based extracts, and is made with Avene Thermal Spring Water. Overall, I'm more than pleased with this serum results, recommend it, and plan to purchase a full size when I'm able to.

Reviews: If you‚Äôve been following me for awhile than you know that I have oily to combo, acne prone skin. When my hormones are a little wacky I also tend to see acne on my jaw line. It was perfect when I received a sample of Aven√©‚Äòs cleanance concentrate blemish serum from sugar pop in exchange for my honest review. This concentrate blemish serum is formulated without harsh ingredients, plant based extracts, & Av√®ne Thermal Spring Water. This serum is designed to help reduce excess oil & the appearance of blemishes with results available in as soon as 7 days. The serum itself is thick, creamy, & opaque white with a strong scent of alcohol (which is the second ingredient on the list so keep that in mind). I received only a small foil sample of this serum so I was able to use it three times as a spot treatment. I noticed that after applying this once a day for three days that two of the pimples I had developed on the underside of my jawline had visibly shrunken & were beginning to heal. Since I had only a small amount of this to try I wasn‚Äôt able to try this all over my face so I can‚Äôt yet report if it reduced oiliness or preventative acne capability. I also noticed it left a slightly sticky film. I didn‚Äôt experience any reactions or sensitivity when using this. Overall I‚Äôm really happy with this serum & would love to purchase a full size & see how this serum does with levels of oiliness.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I always thought that pimples would be left in my teen years but I was soooo very wrong lol. My skin is very temperamental and I struggle constantly with break outs! I will break out from trying new skin care and make up. I also struggle with hormonal breakouts each month. Not only did this product not make me break out but I also noticed an improvement on my ‚Äúnormal‚Äù break outs. Originally when I first received this product I was a little hesitant to just lather all over my face straight away as it has quite a strong chemical like smell. Often products with a strong scent or harsh products can either make me break out badly or get a rash. I decided to do a spot test on the side of my neck for the first night and left until the next morning. Thankfully I had no reaction and continued with the trial. Great packaging, very easy to disburse just the right amount of product. The product spreads really easily. I found that 1 and a half pumps was more than enough. I was using on my neck as I am lucky enough to get pimples there as well! -.-‚Äú.I used at night before applying my normal moisturizer, after applying my skin felt clean, not tight or sticky. Overall I noticed an improvement in my skin. My existing pimples healed and I did not notice many new pimples pop up. When they did they weren't as angry and I feel like they healed a little quicker. As I mentioned the only ‚Äúdown side‚Äù was the strong smell. However, it dissipates quite quickly once applied to the skin and is not noticeable when you are wearing it. As this product works so well I am more than happy to deal with the scent. I will certainly be purchasing this again!

Reviews: i have only been using for 6 days and I already see such a major difference in my skin. blemishes clear and heal so quickly. it really is a game changer for me.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using the Avene Cleanance Comedomed morning and night for two weeks now. I found it to be quite a thick texture (which I liked!) and read that a few people used it as a moisturiser, so I replaced my usual moisturiser with this product and only applied sunscreen after. It was enough moisture for me to use as a full-time moisturiser but if you have dry or dehydrated skin, you might need to add another hydration layer on top. I have acne-prone skin and breakouts in all areas of my face and lean towards the oily side. I found this product really helped to calm my skin and reduce texture from previous breakouts. It didn't stop the breakouts completely but I did find that my forehead, where I usually get the majority of breakouts, reduced dramatically. I'll definitely continue using this product to see if it helps breakouts in other areas as nothing has seemed to help so far! It took a bit more than seven days to start seeing results but I can see a difference in two weeks so I hope the improvements continue.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This little legend works almost immediately! I saw a definite reduction in acne and spots. My skin felt smoother as it greatly diminished the amount of texture. Still needed moisturiser after using this product as it is not hydrating enough to be the last thing on my face, but that is not an issue. There is also a slight smell but you'll get used to that quite quickly.The gel-like texture is quite nice and a little bit goes a long way so it lasts and lasts. Honestly, a wonder product! I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is struggling with congestion and I will be purchasing again.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was very sceptical at first when I read that this product claims to significantly reduce blemishes and blackheads from 7 days but to also refines pores appearance from 7 days too. Such big claims too, so I was very excited to get my hands onto it and try it ASAP!On first application it was very light weight, didn‚Äôt have a greasy feel and absorbed quickly. I also felt a slight tingle so I knew the formula was getting deep down to attack those blemishes. Once the excess sebum absorbs it leaves a lovely matte finish. Which helped a lot with my oily T - zone. I love that a plant-based active ingredient made from milk thistle oil, works to reduce blemishes and blackheads and limit their reappearance by restoring the balance of the skin. I was using it morning and night within my skin care routine. Within 2 days, I started to see a difference. My red Inflamed blemishes around my chin were at ease and reduced in size. By the end of the week, the blemishes were barely noticeable. I love this product and I‚Äôm so glad I was able to trial it as I honestly would of never purchased this in store but now I know that it actually does work. I‚Äôve already purchased a second bottle and It‚Äôs staying in my skin care routine.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this as a serum after using my cleanser and before moisturiser. This product is marketed as "anti-blemish" acne fighter. It is a thick gel which comes out of a really nice pump bottle, which keeps the contents away from air.The gel at first has a really strong alcohol scent, but once applied on the skin, it disappears quickly. It says on the packaging that this is something to be aware of. Luckily for me, I didn't feel the product caused any irritation or made my skin go red, which is a massive plus, given it has such a strong alcohol smell, which is normally an ingredient I try to avoid.Avene claims this product contains an innovative ingredient called Comedoclastin, which doesn't go into details of what ingredients makes up this technology. In any case, I am giving it 5 stars as my acne-prone skin did not react and also did not develop any new pimples which is a big plus for me.The only downside is that because this is a thick gel, it makes it hard to layer products on afterwards, such as moisturiser and sunscreen. I had to "tap" my moisturiser on afterwards (although this product might actually be sufficient for those with really oily skin). Unfortunately when I tried to apply my zinc sunscreen over this, it causes the product to pill.I am impressed with this product and will continue to use this.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser

It is a thick gel which comes out of a really nice pump bottle, which keeps the contents away from air.The gel at first has a really strong alcohol scent, but once applied on the skin, it disappears quickly. It says on the packaging that this is something to be aware of. Luckily for me, I didn't feel the product caused any irritation or made my skin go red, which is a massive plus, given it has such a strong alcohol smell, which is normally an ingredient I try to avoid.Avene claims this product contains an innovative ingredient called Comedoclastin, which doesn't go into details of what ingredients makes up this technology. In any case, I am giving it 5 stars as my acne-prone skin did not react and also did not develop any new pimples which is a big plus for me.The only downside is that because this is a thick gel, it makes it hard to layer products on afterwards, such as moisturiser and sunscreen. Reviews: One of the things I really love about this product is that it's a serum. It's lightweight and I only have to apply a small amount, otherwise it might become a bit drying. It's probably best to apply this on areas prone to acne and not your entire face. There is a strong scent but it does go away once it's dried. There's no tackiness/stickiness and my moisturizer doesn't pill when applying it on top of this serum, which is great. I have minor breakouts and so far, I find this serum effective in reducing the redness and puffiness of my blemishes. My forehead is also not as oily as it was before trying this out. I would continue using this to see how well it works in the long term.

I didn't notice this do anything about existing dark marks, it did seem like budding blemishes went away a little more quickly instead of turning into painful deep tissue monster zit. The smell is a bit medicinal and seems heavily alcohol based, but it didn't cause any dry skin scales like other blemish products with heavy alcohol scent. I probably would have went with 3.5 stars but half points weren't an option so I went with 4. This may work better for someone that has different types of skin complaints.

It absorbed quickly and the medicinal smell faded rapidly. It does not, however, have the beautiful Avene scent that I had hoped for.... The scent of of the other products in the Cleanance line. Overall all it is a very effective serum. It is bringing out the problem areas from congestion. A little goes a long way. It has a pump that gives you enough to cover the entire face. I would recommend it to anyone who who wants to clear up the facial breakouts. I use the Cleanance Expert Lotion after I have let this serum absorb. It smells beautiful.

Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using this product for about 2 and a half weeks now. The texture of the moisturizer is smoothe when you put it on your skin and dries quite quickly. I would highly recommend this product for people that have oily/blemish proned skin. ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product comes in a simple pump packaging that makes it easy (and hygienic!) to use. It has the consistency of a gel and sinks into the skin quite quickly. I only needed to use a small amount on my cheeks/jawline so this will last quite a while. While it did reduce the appearance of acne, and has prevented any further outbreaks, I will note that it has a very strong and rather unpleasant chemical smell. It even notes this on the packaging - "The product's odor is related to its innovative ingredient and will quickly disappear". While it did eventually disappear I did find it a bit overpowering at first. I also noticed it had a bit of a drying effect on my skin, though this was helped by using some moisturiser after application. Overall, would recommend for those with acne issues, but be warned of the strong smell!

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have oily skin and this product worked well to reduce the amount of shine and left my skin with a matte finish. The product did reduce the appearance of blemishes somewhat. I'll be buying this product again.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: I suffer from cystic acne and have heavy scarring and frequent blemishes. I have tried e-v-e-r-y-t-h-i-n-g under the sun save for a doctor's visit. I was really hoping the Cleanance Concentrate Blemish Control Serum would be the ticket to clear skin, but I honestly couldn't tell you if there was a difference as the sample I received was not large enough to make a difference. Acne products (particularly serums) can take months to achieve a noticeable effect and a single use will not make any difference other than to see how the product smells, looks, feels, etc. The product smells heavily of alcohol and I was worried that it would dry my skin but so far I have not see too much drying. It is a thicker consistency than a lot of serums and was easy to apply and did not leave my skin feeling greasy. I feel like I could give a higher star rating if I had the opportunity to try the product out for at least a month or two, but I will probably not purchase.

ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: This gel-like serum is easy to apply and good to layer with other skincare. I still had a tiny breakout while using this but seems like it did prevent a cystic acne from maturing.

Reviews: Using a sample is obviously not enough to know whether this product would help my skin/acne, but I don't have a great feeling about it based on the ingredients. The main ingredients are water and isopropyl alcohol, and generally putting isopropyl alcohol all over your face is not good for your skin (especially with an already compromised moisture barrier). I moisturized right after applying the serum and did not have any negative reaction. So while I don't have an actively negative opinion about it, it's hard for me to imagine buying it.

Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I trialled this Avene product for 13 days. Its a smooth gel consistency that sits great under makeup. I did find that my oily, blemish prone skin improved, however, I think over a longer period of time, I would have better results. The gel is non greasy, but definitely has a smell to it. I would say this would be great for those with sensitive oily, blemish prone skin and even those in their teens.

I feel that this was from the alcohol that was used in it and made it smell bad. I wish I was provided with an ingredients list prior to trialling the product. ProductName: Avene Cleanance Comedomed Anti-Blemishes Concentrate 30ml - Acne moisturiser
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was excited to try this blemish-fighting concentrate from Av√®ne, as although I've not used any products from the brand in the last few years, I did remember the Cleanance range being quite good for my skin.Unfortunately Cleanance Comedomed just doesn't suit my skin - in Winter, at least. I have oily, congested skin, but it has been a but dehydrated as the cooler weather sets in in Central Victoria, and I've found my cheeks and forehead have been dryer than they had been than when using my previous product. I did also break out and get two whiteheads, which whilst already uncommon for me, were in areas of my face where I don't even get blackheads so I don't think this was just my skin purging with the introduction of a new product.The product itself has an odd scent, but which dissipates soon after application and isn't a major concern. I like that the product comes in a pump bottle, with one pump the perfect amount for my face.As above, I have liked Av√®ne products in the past and do trust the brand, so I will use the remainder of the product, but likely alternating with my usual serums and moisturisers.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Have tried a lot of sunscreens over the years looking for one that was actually weightless, non-chalky and did not irritate my skin and almost always have been disappointed in them. I had basically given up finding a good day to day facial sunscreen until I tried Avene's Aqua Fluid Face. I have sensitive, easily dehydrated combination skin with a T zone that can go from settled to "fry chips" in an hour with the wrong products. I found this product moisturising enough to use over the top of toner/serum alone, instead of on top of my moisturiser, and I would recommend if you tend to slick easily in humid, hot conditions that you see which works better for you. I hate the feeling of any product on my face and tend to be a face toucher so I notice immediately if my face is getting shiny. This gives a lovely satin finish to the skin that is comfortable on low humidity days. Easily removed with micellar water or an oil cleanse as a first step. I wear contacts and did not experience any eye irritation or issues and I had patted the sunscreen across my whole face including the eye and lip areas. Under a light dusting of mineral powder I felt great for a full day with no weird oxidising side effects. Definitely recommend giving this a try if you have been searching for a suitable facial sunscreen without any luck previously

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: This sunscreen is nothing short of perfect. it doesn't irritate my sensitive skin. ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I‚Äôm so glad I found this product! Sunscreens usually make my skin oily or make my makeup pill or separate but this one applies and wears well! It‚Äôs light and not too goopy to apply. Will be great through summer!

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Lightweight and not too sticky. Good size for the  beach bag.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Perfect daily SPF that layers well under makeup without peeling. Formula is light weight and non-irritating. Has fast become one of our go to daily spfs

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I don‚Äôt normally wear sunscreen because I don‚Äôt like the thick sticky texture that comes with most sunscreens. Even ‚Äúlightweight‚Äù sunscreens end up being too thick for my liking so I was totally BLOWN AWAY at how incredibly thin and light this sunscreen is! The milky texture makes it glide onto the skin perfectly! The sunscreen layer is so light that I can easily apply makeup over the top without feeling like my makeup is melting into my sunscreen. I took off a star because of the smell though. It‚Äôs not the worst but I have smelt some nicer ones!

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I have been using the Avene sunscreen aqua fluid for a couple of weeks now and I am really happy with it. It is lightweight and very easy to spread. It also goes perfectly under make up. I would definitely buy this product again and recommend it to my friends.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I didn't really know what to expect from this product and that continued when I squeezed some out onto my hand. I think we're so used to sunscreen being thick but this is so light. ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: This sunscreen is really lightweight which is great when applying to your face, it feels like you are wearing nothing at all. Overall a great sunscreen and the bottle size is convenient to keep in your handbag.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I was expecting great things from this product as I regularly use other Avene skincare products in my day to day skin routine. It sat nicely under my makeup each day, without feeling heavy.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I have been using this sunscreen for a few weeks now and it‚Äôs easily become a staple in my routine. It is lightweight, hydrating and gives a slight sheen to the skin. I have very dry sensitive skin and I didn‚Äôt react to this one at all. It works quite well under makeup. My only issue is that it goes a bit white on my brown skin. In conclusion this sunscreen works quite well, doesn‚Äôt feel too sticky and doesn‚Äôt pill on the skin. Very affordable too!

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: This is an incredibly light, watery sunscreen that would be great for Summer as it's non sticky and sinks in relatively quick. It doesn't smell the best, slightly sour, but I still haven't tried a sunscreen that smells nice and the smell does dissipate after it's on your face.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I love the texture of this sunscreen. It‚Äôs like a serum and easily absorbed into the skin. It‚Äôs really lightweight and perfect under makeup.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: The Av√®ne Sunscreen Aqua Fluid SPF50+ does everything it claims! I have extremely dry acne prone skin, and its lightweight formula is essential to get the protection, whilst also not irritating my skin. I would recommend having in your handbag, as its a great travel size.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I have tried it and it‚Äôs great size bottle and it feels nice on the skin but it‚Äôs too runny and comes out too quickly so I prefer cream.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I am usually quite cautious about sunscreen but  really liked this. ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I love this sunscreen, fragrant free and it's super lightweight, it absorbs pretty much straight away into your skin, so it's great for wearing everyday under your makeup.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Love the fluid light texture of this sunscreen

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Light-weight as described. Doesn‚Äôt irritate my sensitive skin. Easy to apply foundation after it. I like that it has no fragrance, won‚Äôt make your face all very white.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Avene wasn‚Äôt kidding when they said it was ultra-lightweight. It does have the appearance of it being watered down & it‚Äôs very runny but a little goes very far, you only need a small amount. It is fragrance free but smells unpleasant once you‚Äôve rubbed it in and it smelt even worse once I applied it after a couple of hrs at the beach. On the plus side I came home with no sunburn so this sunscreen does the job.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: great little pack easy to bring with me everywhere and pop on when needed.  Non greasy which is such a big bonus with sunscreen. Love it.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Cute bright easy to pop into your handbag packaging that‚Äôs very practical too. I enjoyed that it was suitable for sensitive skin and was very high protection sunscreen. It‚Äôs not sticky and sat well under my make up for the day. The only negatives were even though it‚Äôs fragrance free it has light smell to it that I can‚Äôt quite explain and that it is hard to reapply over makeup if needed due to the white colouring of liquid (I tried to reapply it with a sponge over makeup after 2 hours). ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: I like the effect of the product on my skin. I used it before applying the makeup, the absorption was quick and left the skin without shine. I use sunscreen every day on my face and I will continue to use Av√®ne Sunscreen aqua-fluid.

Aside from that, it‚Äôs a really comfortable wear, doesn‚Äôt have the usual sunscreen scent and is nice and thin when applied.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: Thought I'd give this a go but not as good as La Roche Posay Invisible Fluid. This by comparison I found didn't go in as quickly and left a white cast on me.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

There was no tingles or anything that came from this product and felt light and non irritant on my face.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

I do love that this doesn't interact with my makeup, and that it is unscented, however, and otherwise, this is a brilliant sunscreen.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin

And considering I‚Äôm veeeeery pale - then I feel bad for any poor soul with more bronzed skin that purchases this as it just sits on your skin and is hard work to get it to absorb. I wish I‚Äôd just paid the extra money and got the La Roche Posay Anthelios fluid sunscreen. Really regret this purchase.

ProductName: Avene Sunscreen Aqua-fluid SPF50+ 40ml - For Sensitive Skin
Reviews: was greasy and beaded off in gross white sweat beads which didn't look very appealing

Then you simply cleanse your skin and apply a daytime moisturiser.  My skin felt silky soft and very smooth.  If you are experiencing facial skin dehydration then this is the product for you.

Some not-so-good sides: extreme white cast (given applied correct amount/ reapplying/ and I'm asian with white pale skin tone it's still white) - with second application it starts to mess up around, spilled off, creating a thick visible layer on your face - it does sting the eyes (combination sunscreen) It does also stain clothes white hence I can't use it as body spf.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+  Face and Body  Lotion 100ml
Reviews: I really wanted to love this sunscreen, as I love the Avene brand, and had seen positive reviews. But this sunscreen is very overpriced for what it is, and leaves a horrible white cast. I've tried a lot of sunscreens both chemical and physical, and this has the worst cast I've ever experienced. I would expect this cast if the sunscreen was physical, but this is chemical, so I don't understand why it's so bad.You can't wear it on your face or under makeup. It's good as a gentle sunscreen, and if you're prepared to look like a ghost, then this is fine. But unfortunately I would not repurchase, as there are much better SPF 50 sunscreens around.

ProductName: Avene Gentle Milk Cleanser 200ml
Reviews: I absolutely loved the Milk Cleanser for dry to very dry skin that came in a pump that you rinsed off. Now they changed the formula and added soy in it. Ladies beware. Soy is a phytoestrogen and as such builds estrogen in your body which is a cause for breast cancer. Same with evening primrose and borage oil. Yet skin care companies are now putting these ingredients in their products. I know a 35 year old that was getting hot flashes and her doctor asked to see her moisturizer and sure enough it had soy in it. Now they ruined one of the best milk cleansers by adding soy in it so I'm on the lookout for a new one. I won't buy this again. And it's pretty fishy that they are keeping the ingredients off of the website, but when you get your bottle you will see it on there. Ladies, take care of yourself and always look at to see that soy and evening primrose and borage oil and wild yam are not in your skin care.

ProductName: Avene Hyaluron Activ B3 Renewal Firming Cream 50ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just wanted to stop by and leave a review for what I think is one of the best skin care products on the market for me. I would definitely recommend adding this to your skincare regime. I'll certainly be buying more in the future. I'm very impressed.Another thing I really like about this is that all of the ingredients used in the cream are of natural origin and it is free from any animal products. Also I'd like to mention the packaging and design... the cream itself comes in a pod that is placed inside a recyclable/re-usable glass jar, which I think is great and a lot more environmentally conscious that a lot of other products you see on the market today. Thanks Av√©ne!

It initially feels like quite a heavy face cream but it goes on so smoothly and has such a light silky feel once absorbed into my face. This cream has been an absolute life saver during this winter as I get dry flaky skin around my nose and lips but have not struggled with dry skin at all with daily use. Also haven't noticed my skin being oily or any breakouts with continued daily use. No reaction on my somewhat sensitive skin. My skin looks healthier, softer and it seems to have also minimized my fine lines, what a win! The fragrance is also clean and subtle. Would recommend as a great all-rounder, every-day moisturiser for those who have slightly dryer, combination-skin.
