ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Love it!! Its very silky and smooth on my skin. Very hydrating for my skin

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I've been applying the Revitalizing Nourishing Cream every morning and evening as I haven't been wearing make up whilst working from home. I've noticed my skin feel instantly  hydrated, nourished and definitely no signs of dryness.I love the natural Berry Extract which is only mild in smell but feels smoothing and definitely feels like a skin barrier protecting me and felt as though my skin has been somewhat restored. I definitely prefer skincare products that include Vitamin E, which helps to protect the skin against external nasties and vitamins are always great for the skin. Another thing I liked about the ingredients was that it is very rich in Thermal Spring Water for its soothing and anti-irritating properties.However,  the cream promotes being 'non-greasy' and rapidly absorbed, I would have to disagree, I actually felt the product on my face and slightly greasy even hours after application but I do feel that this cream has felt like it's provided long-lasting nourishment.My skin definitely does feel nourished, more radiant and has helped me with signs of tired looking skin as I've now got a healthy and glowing complexion.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I  was really looking forward to trying this product as we are getting into the colder months my skin is looking dull and dry, I also have sensitive skin and this product has been a god sent as hasn‚Äôt irritated my skin at all which is fantastic.The product comes in a cute white jar and even includes an applicator which is good as I don‚Äôt have to use my fingers to get the product out. The cream is rich and non greasy with a pleasant scent that isn‚Äôt strong, I find over powering smells very off putting and they can cause a reaction.I was use the cream after cleaning my face and applying my oils and serums, it absorbs into the skin really well is a great way to finish off my face routine. After using this for a couple of weeks I have noticed a difference in my skin, the dry spots on my face are gone and I feel really hydrated.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: It comes in a beautiful jar, the packaging is simple and elegant. Really happy they included a spatula in their packaging for the purpose of hygienecally  dispensing the product.The cream has a soft velvet texture . It has a subtle fragrance. It blends into my skin effortlessly, without leaving a greasy film.My skin feels instantly hydrated and nourished after I apply this cream. I feel it makes my skin glow healthily, The dull texture and appearance diminishes .My skin feels soft and all the dry patches are gone.After using it for almost a week , it transformed my skin back to soft smooth texture.It does not irritate the skin at all.  My skin does not look tired and dull anymore. It looks fresh and has a glow.I love that this cream can be used both for day and night. It does not have spf , so during the day time you have to top up with an spf cream.Would buy again because loving the results.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: This package clean design cube box. After opening it, there is a spatula came with that (which I think it's very thoughtful of hygienic issue). After opening the jar/tube, there was a foil sealing the product. I like the subtle smell of this cream, not those chemical smell, and you can smell how gentle and nourish it is.I fell in love with this cream from my first use. The texture is in cream texture but a bit lighter. Only need to massage on my face and neck area for less than a minute. The product is non-greasy nor sticky and would melt into the skin and feel like there is a protected film . It left my skin hydrated throughout the day and love that soft to touch feeling on my skin.This cream is so gentle that I can even use it around my eyes area instead of putting additional eye cream.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I received the Eau Thermale Av√®ne Revitalizing Nourishing Cream as part of the BH trial team. My skin is normal-dry and I have just started experiencing skin sensitivity (ah, the joys of post-partum). Here are some features that I would like to highlight about my experience with the product:- The packaging is a light-weight, yet sturdy acrylic jar, although it is not easily recyclable;- No SPF, although I am yet to find the perfect day cream that has decent SPF;- Can be used in the day or evening; perfect for those minimalists!- No detectable fragrance;- No fancy-schmancy ingredients like retinol, vitamin c, hydrolytic acid or unicorn tears. This isn‚Äôt too much of a concern for me as I am happy to age gracefully (read, I am too lazy/too tired to bother);- The cream was perfectly suitable for my dry and dehydrated skin. My face immediately felt soft after application and my dry patches were kept at bay. The cream also absorbed nicely although I can‚Äôt comment in whether it affected make-up application because #isolife;- I personally didn‚Äôt experience any skin sensitivity when using this product; and- Readily available and often on sale!This product gets a big tick from me and I would happily purchase this with my own money in the future.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: This is a fantastic nourishing cream for dry skin, perfect for the cold winter weather. Usually in Winter, my skin is so dry and gets flakey due to the cold so I tend to slather on thick layers of creams. This avene cream is thick and buttery, feels really comforting on my dry skin. I love that it is creamy and spreads very easily. The cream is filled with antioxidants and the avene water providing hydrating and moisture to the skin.The cream comes in a jar with a spatula making it very easy to dispense. Usually i find jar packaging a bit unhygienic but given the thick, buttery formula, it makes more sense that its in a jar.After using it for the last two weeks, my skin is noticeably softer and it doesn't feel tight or dry. The cream works really well even on my sensitive skin and I find that it is very soothing on my skin and strengthens my skin barrier.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: As someone who gets incredibly dry in the colder months this product is definitely now a go-to for me.Firstly the packaging reminds me of a high end product. The little jar is white and glossy and looks very nice on my makeup counter.A little bit goes a long way, when I first received the product to trial I used way more than I needed which just shows this product will actually last a decent amount of time.It is a thicker moisturiser which melts into the skin quickly and left my face feeling so juicy and plump until nighttime which I found really impressive.Makeup layers ontop beautifully and it even replaced my need to use a primer so I can‚Äôt complain about that!This really impressed me. My skin is fairly normal to dehydrated and this will be a staple for me for the next few months as well as the perfect overnight treatment for my skin when it needs an extra boost.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I was looking forward to trialling this product as my skin has been looking particularly dull, and dehydrated after a long summer and coming into winter. I've also been suffering from some congestion around my mouth and eyebrows which meant I needed to do some additional work with clay masks and AHAs for exfoliation. This cream was the perfect way to inject moisture back into my sensitive skin, plumping it beautifully.The cream comes in a chic glass jar with a spatula to ensure good hygiene. The actual product has a lovely soft fragrance which didn't seem to irritate my skin at all. My skin is usually sensitive to fragrances which cause break outs.The cream is thick and rich but non-greasy and absorbs easily into your skin instantly nourishing it.I have been using it in the  morning and evening after cleansing and applying serums. It worked well to lock in moisture and as a base for my makeup. My skin seemed to glow after applying the cream. For daytime I made sure to use an spf after applying the cream.Overall, I have absolutely loved using this product!

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: The cooler weather has literally had my skin stinging this year, to get this cream was a godsend.It's in a generous size tub and comes with a spatula. I will only say the spatula does the job but does look and feel very cheap.The cream itself is amazing. My skin just drank it in. Within minutes of applying it had sunk in ready for my sunscreen.It soothed my very sensitive skin and actively helped dry patches I had on my upper cheeks.It did not cause my face to sting or react badly in any way, I usually have a few days of that happening before my face accepts new skincare.The feeling of plump hydrated skin lasted all day, and after applying at night I'd wake in the morning feeling as though it were freshly applied.I would only recommend this cream to people who have normal to dry skin, it really is a moisture hit.It did not cause any breakouts which was wonderful.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I have always found my skin difficult to find the right products for as it is sensitive (rosacea), blemish prone and dry (especially dry where I have blemishes healing). While using this Avene moisturiser, my skin has improved drastically in a short amount of time. My dry patches are almost completely gone,  my skin is less red overall, my blemishes are fewer and the ones that I had before using the product have been healing much better, and with less redness. The product sinks into the skin really well and leaves your face very soft and supple. I feel that my skin has looked more radiant and smooth in photos which has really boosted my confidence. The jar is a good size and the product goes a long way, I appreciated that it came with a small scoop to use when getting moisturiser out of the jar. The texture and smell of the moisturiser reminds me of sunscreen (not quite as greasy, and the smell is very subtle). Overall, this product has had the hugest impact on my skin out of all the individual products I've tried, and it really makes me want to try more products from Avene. This product is amazing for dry skin now that we are close to Winter, and I will definitely continue using this product.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Would highly recommend this product. Although it is quite an expensive moisturiser, I do believe that a good quality moisturiser goes a long way.The product itself comes in a beautiful round tub which almost looks like glass, and a small flat scooping tool that is perfect as it enables you to never touch the product by hand when scooping it out. I believe every moisturiser should have one!You can tell by the quality of it as soon as you scoop the tiniest amount which goes a long way. It has a beautiful cream like scent which is not overpowering, as some moisturiser can have a strange strong smell.When applied, the moisturiser glides onto your face smoothly and makes you feel refreshed. I have dry skin and believe that it sits wonderfully on my skin and does not make my face oily either.The scent and texture of it keeps you wanting to apply more although a little goes a long way.I was using this with the Av√®ne thermal spring water and the ordinary serum and putting the moisturiser on last.Can not fault this product

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: The revitalising nourishing cream has been an absolute saviour for me the last few weeks with the cold weather we have been having! after just having a baby I have had no time to do anything for myself but applying this morning and night has got me through! This cream melts straight into my skin and my skin feels so soft, supply and hydrated after every use! The smallest amount goes such a long way, I have also been focused on putting it all over my neck  as well! I have been such a fan of Avene products and they are perfect for my dry sensitive skin and so affordable!  I can‚Äôt wait to see how my skin goes throughout winter Using this product! I have very high hopes! Thank you so much for sending me this to trial, I will defiently be purchasing when I have finished it!

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Thanks BH for allowing me to be apart of the trial. I was super excited to be apart of this trial as I have heard so many good things about Avene.The revitalising nourishing cream has some fanstasic ingredients, there are so many benefits for this product. The cream made my skin look radiant and glows I was shocked at the look of my skin. I haven‚Äôt been using make up lately and this has just boosted my skin. It‚Äôs super hydrating and you don‚Äôt need any other product like serum or anything. The overall apprearance of my skin looks fresh and glowy. It left my skin feel refreshed and moisturised but not sticky. It absorbed really well into my skin. I was a little worried at first because of the scents that it would effect my skin but it didn‚Äôt. I have super dry sentsive skin and I‚Äôm always worried that new products will affect my skins and both the mask and creams did not affect or irritate my skin at all. I‚Äôm super impressed by both products and would highly recommend.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: During this trial I applied EAU THERMALE AV√àNE REVITALIZING NOURISHING CREAM both morning and night. Coming into winter my skin can feel tight, dry and very thirsty so moisture comfort is a must and this AV√àNE cream delivered. A little bit goes a long way so you don‚Äôt have to slather it on to get great results.It has a very soft, pretty scent that doesn't linger or make my eyes water. The cream is white in colour and is ultra-creamy and extra-rich but it didn't make my foundation slip around which is a big bonus for me. I love that it is versatile and can be use both morning and night making it perfect to take on holidays.This cream provides intense moisture but I also found that it calmed my skin and I loved using it. My skin feels plump, hydrated, smooth and with a healthier glow. I am really happy with the results and I will continue to use this product.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Personally I am a big fan of Avene products. I have been using Avene products(various) for 5 years. Each Avene product worked really well on my skin. This time, Beautyheaven sent me EAU THERMALE AV√àNE REVITALIZING NOURISHING CREAM for trial. I never used it before, it is not that cheap. I usually apply two different moisturiser every morning and night. I stopped using them and replaced those to EAU THERMALE AV√àNE REVITALIZING NOURISHING CREAM. All I can say that it feels much better that using those moisturisers. EAU THERMALE AV√àNE REVITALIZING NOURISHING CREAM is lighter and keep my skin moist all day and night. I also feel that my skin becomes smooth and moist after using it. Even though I apply sun cream, foundation and compact cushion after EAU THERMALE AV√àNE REVITALIZING NOURISHING CREAM, my skin never feel dry or tightness. Than you Beautyheaven for sending me EAU THERMALE AV√àNE REVITALIZING NOURISHING CREAM! I will definitely buy this product in the future.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: The cream is a thick consistency and has a light scent to it that goes away after application. I have been using this cream for four consecutive nights and have found this cream is working well for my red, sensitive skin as I have had no skin irritation at all and it left my skin feeling moisturised, plump and healthy upon application and all the way till the next morning. I also found that my redness was slightly less after application.Additionally, I usually have the issue that when I try new creams they can cause congestion on my forehead and this has not occurred using the Avene Nourishing and Soothing cream.The packaging comes with a spatula for hygiene which is helpful for not being wasteful and using the correct amount of product.Overall I am satisfied with this product, will continue to use it and would recommend to people with the target skin types.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I‚Äôm a mum of 2 toddlers, my skincare routine has taken a backseat and as a result, my skin always looks tired, dull and dry.  The Avene Revitalizing Nourishing Cream, has a pleasant light fragrance and the cream felt thick, rich and velvety. When applying the product on my face, it felt so soothing, calming and refreshing. I could instantly feel my dry skin being hydrated and reenergised. I‚Äôve been using the product twice a day (morning and evening) after deep cleansing and it has left my skin feeling soft, smooth and revitalized. I‚Äôve been pairing this cream with Avene‚Äôs Soothing Radiance Mask for twice the hydration and radiance.I‚Äôve seen this brand on the shelves but haven‚Äôt had the opportunity to try any of the products before. I‚Äôd definitely recommend this product if you are looking  for a cream which boosts hydration and re-energizes tired, dull and dry looking skin.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Very cosmetically elegant. Nice slip. Moisturizing enough. However, I think that the fragrance is too strong, docking 1 star.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I like Avene products as my skin is very sensitive and they have never caused irritation, I also have dry skin and decided to try this moisturiser.  It comes in a lightweight plastic tub and has a spatula for application.  It's a fairly lightweight cream and I am used to dry skin moisturisers that have a balm consistency , so I think that's one of the reasons why I felt it did'nt hydrate my skin enough. It could be that I underestimated how dry my skin is and a product for very dry skin is more suited to me.  So I use this during the day and apply a heavier moisturiser at night ( Avene skin recovery balm). I think this is fine for normal to dry sensitive skin, or might make a good night cream for someone who does'nt like oily or heavy face creams.  It's o.k,  but not suited to my skin especially over the winter months.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: This does feel nice but it doesn‚Äôt seem to absorb into my skin. It sort of sits on top and makes it look greasy.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I love this product! I‚Äôve turned many clients on to it. The texture and feel is very lovely. My only downside was it caused some breakouts. I suppose it‚Äôs too rich for my skin type but it certainly feels good going on!

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Simply love this cream. Rich but yet very light. I like the way it is absorbed into the skin rapidly. I never feel like I have greasy skin.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Has become one of my favourite moisturisers to use especially during the winter. Friendly on the skin and leaves a soft nice touch

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Love Av√®ne products, and this one is no exception. Nourishing, super hydrating without being oily or harsh on sensitive skin. A lovely, luxurious cream- perfect to get you through that dry winter skin stage.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I loved this cream since the moment I opened it! Not only does the packaging feel so luxurious but the cream has an amazing texture and isn't too scented. After using this product for about two weeks, I can see how hydrated and how much smoother my skin is looking. I am in love.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: So, I know that Avene does a lot of great products, which I love, but this one has to be one of their best yet! This hydrating cream comes in a jar, which has a nice and firm heft to it, and the product is easy to scoop out of the packaging.I love that this glides over the face really well, without feeling too thick and doesn‚Äôt just sit on the skin. This really does help with the winter dryness, and at a reasonable price!

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I use this product after I take off my daily makeup and it has nourished my skin. The product is lightweight and doesn‚Äôt leave my skin greasy or anything. Highly recommend.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Such a beautiful, soft, fluffy and dreamy moisturiser. This beauty is lovely and lightweight yet with a comfortable density that leaves my skin feeling hydrated and moisturised all day, without being too rich. Performs beautifully with other serums/products and also a lovely base before makeup. I've been using it consistently each morning for about 3 weeks, my skin feels nice and bouncy, hydrated and soft afterwards and i enjoy the light + creamy fresh scent. This moisturiser is a great all rounder and very kind to sensitive or dry skins, would recommend!

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I‚Äôve been using this morning & night for a couple weeks and I‚Äôm very impressed. Has a very nice thick consistency but doesn‚Äôt feel heavy on my skin. Has been my saviour this winter

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Love the packaging , sturdy glass jar. Cream feels lightweight and sets into the skin fast. Feels very moisturizing and quenching. I used this cream on my neck and chest. As I do not  wear basic creams on my face as my skin there does not need extra hydration or oils or oclusive barrier. Though love using the creams on my neck and chest, as skin there is delicate and does not have such a generous oil/sebum production as my face skin has. Have noticed that keeps my skin hydrated and there is no crepey look after I have slept for hours on side overnight. Skin just bounces back after being squished, and keeps looking and feeling smooth and soft.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I preferred this product before they made the switch from the glass packaging to the current packaging. Before the change, the scent was very light and was my holy grail product and the only moisturizer I could repurchase again and again. Now the fragrance is quite strong and almost an entirely different scent altogether. I find that it doesn't feel as nourishing as it once did. Will probably be looking for another product to replace it.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I have dry, sensitive skin which is prone to breakouts and finding a product that helps soothe the breakouts while not being too drying is difficult. I tried the Avene revitalizing nourishing cream and really liked it. It comes in the classic Avene white box and the jar inside looks really luxurious, it also has a small spatula to scoop out the cream which I really liked however I would have preferred if there was a place to fit the spatula inside on top of the jar so that its kept safe.The cream smells nice, it has a soft subtle fragrance which reminds me of another cream from my childhood, I wish the fragrance was unique but I don't mind it as its nice.The product absorbs well and doesn't leave my skin greasy which is a plus and it still hydrates very well, I had no dry patches while I was using it and face felt soft to the touch. It also calmed down my breakouts making it the perfect cream for my skin type.Overall the product does what it  claims, nourishes the dry skin and calms it.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: The skin on my face is naturally dry and has been a bit sensitive lately with the changing seasons. Fortunately, I have been given the opportunity to trial the Revitalizing Nourishing Cream from Avene. I have never used anything from this brand before, so I enjoyed not only trialling this but also reading all about the brand in the accompanying information brochure.The jar is pretty big and heavy, it is not something you would necessarily want to take on holiday although at 50ml it does fit within the airline allowances for liquids. There is perhaps too much plastic that goes into the jar and it doesn‚Äôt seem to be too environmentally friendly, however the jar is recyclable so that is positive.This face cream is a rich cream, which I prefer applying at night time but which can also be used during the day. It has a cold cream feel to it, and the smell is like fresh laundry or baby powder, which is not my favourite. The smell quickly fades however. The result is an enduring feeling of softness and hydration which lasts for several hours. I have noticed some really positive smoothing effects, and some redness on my face has calmed down since using this cream. My eyes which are very sensitive to fragrances don‚Äôt seem to mind this cream at all which is nice and confirms that the brand is committed to providing products for sensitive skin. This is a good face cream that lives up to its hydration claims.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I had never used any Av√®ne products before so I was keen to give this moisturiser a go.  My first impression was the box was a little plain and boring, but the jar inside looked quite classy.  It has a thick edge however so the volume of product is less than you might imagine.  It also comes with a small plastic spatula which can be useful for hygienic application if you use it correctly however I find it is a waste of plastic as it is bother to store and clean fingers are just as good.The moisturiser itself is thick and creamy.  It has a light scent which doesn‚Äôt remind me of anything except moisturiser.  It feels very hydrating to apply and while I thought it might be a bit rich, it absorbed reasonably quickly.  I did notice a few tiny breakouts while trying this cream and while I don‚Äôt think that is unusual when trying a new skincare product it does normally stop after a few weeks.  Unfortunately, the trial was too short to determine if this happened but I will keep using the cream to find out.    After using this product for a couple of weeks along with the mask twice a week, my skin feels more hydrated to touch but there is no noticeable difference in appearance except for some breakout as mentioned.I was disappointed that the cream does not contain SPF and for that reason alone I would not choose this as my daily morning product.   That fact aside, if the breakouts calm down after my skin adapts to the product, I think it is a lovely hydrating cream.  I would be hesitant to purchase it at the price tag however when I‚Äôve tried many comparable products at lower price points.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: The Avene's revitalising nourishing cream has a lightweight lotion-like texture which feels nice and it just glides on my face effortlessly. The cream has a beautiful but gentle scent which I enjoy and it doesn't cause irritation to my skin.  I apply a decent layer of cream on my face and neck every morning and evening. The cream absorbs into my skin almost instantly and doesn't leave any residue behind or sticks to my pillow when I sleep. When I use it in the morning, the cream keeps my face moisturised throughout the day in an indoor environment. When I use it in evening, I wake up to a smooth well moisturised skin. However, I have dry skin and I feel that this cream is good to use during the warmer months but not hydrating/ moisturising enough during colder/ dryer months. After using this cream for two weeks, I can see my skin stay hydrated.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I like Avene products and already use a few so I decided to get this from the rewards room. It comes in a jar that looks bigger than it is due to artful packaging that looks like glass but is actually plastic.  A plastic spatula was also provided. This is marketed towards dry and sensitive skin, maybe my skin is drier than I thought as this did'nt moisturise it enough. I prefer thicker moisturisers and this felt too lightweight. I ended up using this in the mornings and applied a heavier moisturiser at night. This may be more suited towards someone looking for a lightweight moisturiser. I like that it did'nt irritate my sensitive skin and I appreciate the opportunity to try it by redeeming points, but It's not a product I would repurchase.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: I absolutely love this product, but been very disappointed lately when I open the lid and finding out the product is not flush to the top. There must have been an air pocket and when I spent that much for the facial cream I want the jar to be filled to the top.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: extremely hydrating and thick consistency. feels great on and perfect for sensitive skin. only problem is the scent for me. Intense rise smell which I do not particularly like. Other than that it‚Äôs a great moisturizer.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: i put this on at night after using avene foaming facial cleanser and i wake up with greasy looking and feeling skin the next morning. i have tried adjusting the amount im using and using less does not change this effect. not for me but to each their own!

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: Big thanks again to Beauty Heave and Avene in including me in this trial. I've used a lot of Avene products and always welcome the opportunity to try new ones.The directions are to apply after cleansing and to wear twice a day, so it's a day/nighttime moisturiser.  It also says you can spray the Avene thermal water (which luckily I still have some in my cabinet) after application to soothe and calm any feelings of discomfort. I tried it with and without the spray. I preferred it with a spritz of the spray as I found it settled better.It says it's for Dry to normal skin types. I'm dry/sensitive myself.I followed the directions to a tee and on day 4, I woke up with a bunch of whiteheads on my forehead, which made me very sad. I think the moisturising cream is just overall, too much moisture for me, so I stopped wearing it for 24 hours and then applied my emergency type skincare to calm my skin down. Then I only applied during the daytime and skipped the nighttime step and went back to my regular evening cream. Then after a few days my skin has calmed down.Overall, I wouldn't purchase as I found it made my skin feel shiny/greasy in appearance and feel so it's sadly, not my holy grail moisturiser.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin
Reviews: The quality does not reflect the price. It‚Äôs very thick, which is nice since I live in the desert, but it takes *forever* to settle into my skin. The fragrance is very 1980s skincare (an artificial, almost plastic scent). I work in a warehouse too, so once I start sweating there is a greasy film on my face from this moisturizer, which clogged up my pores and left a ton of blackheads on my nose.

ProductName: Avene Revitalising Nourishing Cream 50ml - Moisturiser for Dry sensitive skin

Reviews: Eau Thermale Av√®ne A-Oxitive Antioxidant Defense Serum is packaged in the known brands colours, this makes it easy to spot when shopping for it.Post a 3 week trial of this serum one application during the day and one at night, I am going to say that radiance has been boosted however the fine lines not so, only a little softened.This formula has Vitamins C and E. It is very light white fluid that I apply and any residual I always apply to the back of my hands.  This has proven fruitful over the years as my hands have no age spots on them. Always remember to apply all residual products to the back of your hands.Thank you Beauty Heaven for this beautiful "win" I will be using this until its last drop.4*

ProductName: Avene A-Oxitive SERUM Antioxidant Defence Serum 30ml - Vitamin C Serum for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Av√®ne A-Oxitive Antioxidant Defense Serum was super light, but very effective.I liked how quickly the serum absorbed into my skin, but I did think the fragrance component was unnecessary, and may exclude certain users who have sensitive skin.I also cannot comment on the claim made that this product helps with "defence against environmental aggressors" and the other long term use effects, as I have not been using it long enough. However, I actually did experience noticeable fading of my acne scarring, which I was very pleased about! Overall, I really enjoyed using this product and would consider purchasing again if a fragrance free option was made available.

ProductName: Avene A-Oxitive SERUM Antioxidant Defence Serum 30ml - Vitamin C Serum for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great option for anyone wanting to find an easy to use morning serum to add to their routine.I found the texture to be delightful, a gel-cream that absorbs easily into the skin, and no pilling which is a must for me! It has a faint herby, spa-like scent which I didn't find overwhelming and dissipated quickly.The formula was gentle on my skin and I didn't have any reactions (I have mild rosacea). It was very easy to slip into my routine and I loved that as well as the vitamin c, it also contained vitamin e and hydrators - I certainly felt like my skin was plump and juicy after using this!I haven't been using it long enough to notice any reduction in fine lines, but I really enjoy this as a one-and-done morning serum. I would recommend it to anyone who is after bright and bouncy skin and not have to worry about using 3 different serums targeting different things. I will get my husband to try this as well and I think it will be great for him!

ProductName: Avene A-Oxitive SERUM Antioxidant Defence Serum 30ml - Vitamin C Serum for Sensitive skin

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: Firstly I wanted to say I love the pull off tab you need to remove before you can take off the plastic cap. The 200mL bottle is very easy to hold and very appealing on the eye being bright orange with black and white printing. The press down nozzle for the spray is nice and big wide enough to fit my thumb. Once pressed it sprays out a decent amount of the sunscreen white in color great to see where the product is on the skin and doesn‚Äôt spray out too much at a time which I love because it gives me time to rub it in properly before spraying again. It doesn‚Äôt take long to rub in or absorb at all very quickly actually and it dries matte but feels moisturised which for me is very important as I cannot stand that really greasy sunscreen feeling. The scent is nice think sunscreen/skincare and very lovely light scent. Love that this is an all in one face and body spray and has a very high protection of uvb and uva rays. My go to for myself, husband and kids and would recommend this to my friends and family.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Of the three new Avene sunscreens I tried, this was definitely my favorite. The formula isn‚Äôt too runny or greasy and gives you high protection from the sun. It didn‚Äôt  irritate my sensitive skin at all either which was great. Being quite pale, this worked well for me in terms of actual sun protection and not appearing too ‚Äúwhite‚Äù on the skin. It gives a nice glow and great coverage when rubbed in properly. I also swam after using this  and it still stayed on the body for quite a while longer. Definitely recommend!

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently used this whilst on holiday and found it to be the perfect addition to my beach bag. It makes application easy and mess free, despite wind or sand.The formulation is great and I found it to provide adequate protection throughout the day.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really enjoyed this spray SPF! The SPF rating is quite good for the Aussie sun, the smell is pleasant and protected my sensitive skin. ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like this sunscreen. It soaks in easily and immediately to leave less of a white cast than the face and body lotion. The spray nozzle is a bit unpredictable but I got around this when needed by first spraying it into my hand and then applying to my body. Wearing this sunscreen according to instructions, I noticed no colour or burn after exposure to the sun.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have really enjoyed this product, and I think it performs really well as a broad spectrum sunscreen, most suitable for days when you are getting a bit of sun but not too much - it's certainly not something I would take to the beach on a summer day, for example. Beware, however, that I will need to be reapplied if you are sweating/swimming, as it has little in the way of water resistance. Also enjoy the spray function as it makes it easier to apply.

Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love Avene skincare so was excited to try their sunscreen range in the lead up to summer. I wear sunscreen daily and have sensitive skin and this product fitted seamlessly into my routine. The bottle size is large enough to feel you are getting value for money and the lightweight formulation didn't irritate my skin in anyway. I like the spray bottle functionality as it makes it easier to spread across arms, legs and body. The product is lightly scented however this could have been a more pleasant smell, I didn't love it. The output of the spray is not as spread out as I might like either... meaning it could potentially be a more efficient spray. Overall a great product that I will continue to use throughout summer.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This comes in a bright orange 200mL spray bottle that, with its brightness, is easy to find in my straw handbag and spritz on at the beach. The sunscreen offers 40 minutes of water resistant protection with a UV protection of 50+. The sunscreen is lightweight with a mild scent. It applies easily and coats my skin, protecting it from the harmful rays at the beach. Whether I'm swimming in the water or just sweating in the heat, I can relax knowing I have sun protection on.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I liked the lightweight formula of this and the convenience of spray application. Despite that, I kept feeling paranoid that I wasn't using enough. I didn't get any new freckles so the protection must be good. It feels great on the skin and soaks in almost instantly. It smells quite nice compared to other sunscreens and doesn't irritate my skin. Would recommend!

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Av√®ne Sunscreen Spray SPF 50+ is a convenient packaged spray sunscreen with high UV protection. I found this sunscreen to be good for the body but slightly sticky on the face. It is great for a quick spray that doesn't require too much rubbing in. It feels lighter on the skin however it is on the expensive side for sunscreen.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice thick formula, good coverage but a little difficult to spread. Not oily and doesn't leave a filmy/sticky on the skin. Wouldn't recommend for a pool or beach day as the suncream isn't very waterproof, only 40 minutes.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product as a trial, and would definitely recommend it to others.I found the spray nozzle made the sunscreen so easy to apply at the beach, and as the consistency of the sunscreen was very thin, it applied onto the skin so easily and effortlessly.As with the other products in the range, I think this is a really good product, but I'm not really a fan of the subtle scent. Overall however I would recommend this sunscreen to others and would purchase it again myself.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: Bought it because it does not contain harmful chemicals. Smells good and light weight.

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml

ProductName: Avene SPF 50+ Sunscreen Spray 200ml
Reviews: I'm not really a fan of this sunscreen because of the very visible white case it leaves on my skin. When I apply this to my face it fills my lines and makes them look white causing me to keep checking myself in a mirror and continually trying to blend the white cast away. It's also quite greasy. With this sunscreen you need to spray it into your hand first before applying as the mist isn't as fine as I would expect it to be. It comes out quite heavy. The liquid is also very watery and has a fragrance which didn't irritate my combination skin at all. I did find that this protects my skin from the sun but because of the white cast and greasiness I wouldn't use this again once this bottle is empty.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance CONTROL Soothing Skin Recovery Balm 40ml - Moisturiser for hypersensitive and dry skin
Reviews: This is almost a direct copy/paste of my cleanser review, but it applies to this balm, too. My skin is extremely reactive lately. I am acne-prone and my dermatologist has me on a benzoyl peroxide/clindamycin topical in the morning and a tretinoin topical at night. This combination (particularly in the mornings) can cause a lot of stinging, burning, itching, and discomfort after cleansing and applying the topical, and that's before I apply my moisturizer. Moisturizers have traditionally amplified these sensations and it can be so bad that I will avoid my routine for a few days, which exacerbates my acne. I have to use moisturizer due to the drying nature of the medications, and I absolutely must use sunscreen, which is also extremely painful. The problem has been that all of this HURTS! I've only used this moisturizer twice so far, once last night after my tretinoin (usually the time I have no issues, even with other gentle moisturizers), and once this morning following my bzp/clin topical. So far, I am IN LOVE! The morning application didn't burn and make me want to rip my skin off. I'm also using the tolerance extremely gentle cleanser and the combination is lovely. It doesn't burn, itch, sting, or hurt. My face feels moisturized and comfortable, soft, and it doesn't appear overly flaky. I am so thrilled I found this skincare line by total accident. I love my Cetaphil, but even that hasn't cut it with these topical medications. Maybe now I'll actually keep up on the daily routine with my topicals since I don't have to choose between painful, clearer skin and a face riddled with breakouts.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance CONTROL Soothing Skin Recovery Balm 40ml - Moisturiser for hypersensitive and dry skin
Reviews: Have been using for at least 12 months now.  Moisturising but feels  light.  Love it.  I wish it wasn't so expensive as I continuously use through the day on a daily basis.

Reviews: I have been using both the Avene Tolerance Extreme Cream and the Skin Recovery Cream for many years. The new packaging is also much better (the old one always made me pump out too much product). Two things I don't like though are, first, that the tube contains now only 40ml instead of 50ml, and second, that the names are confusing. I didn't realize that there was a balm and cream version in-store and also didn't get that this is the updated version of the skin recovery cream and not the updated tolerance extreme cream.

It absorbs quickly, is never sticky or tacky, never pills-up, and leaves a glowing matte finish. After 12 hours or more of application I still feel hydrated. I'm glad it is made just for the face for my legs & my face are two very different ecosystems! Thank you Avene!

ProductName: Avene Tolerance CONTROL Soothing Skin Recovery Balm 40ml - Moisturiser for hypersensitive and dry skin
Reviews: I am so disappointed. This balm made my skin feel greasy and like it needed to be washed. Avene, please bring back the exact formula of Tolerance Extreme Cream. I hoped that the Tolerance Control Skin Recovery Balm would be a substitute, so I tried that next. This balm is extremely waxy and greasy. As soon as I applied it, I felt the need to wash my face. I only return things that I know I will never use or recommend. I returned this.

ProductName: Avene Tolerance CONTROL Soothing Skin Recovery Balm 40ml - Moisturiser for hypersensitive and dry skin

For some reason, they changed their lines and have added more ingredients‚Äî-including CITRIC ACID in this specific product. I bought it to try it (not even realizing the ingredients changed) and immediately had a reaction. I am devastated.for those of you with sensitive skin, allergic skin, eczema, dry skin- you know what I mean!!! AVENE PLEASE BRING BACK THE ORIGINAL FORMULA

Reviews: This cleanser does the job but leaves me a little dry, so this is not really suitable for dry skin as marketed and certainly does not replenish lipids. Let's talk about the elephant in the room though: the fragrance. It is really nauseating and strong. I am very surprised by the other reviews which have stated that there is not a strong scent or that the scent is light. Fragrance is in the mid-range level in the ingredients list and it is obvious there is a lot of it in the mix. This is also why I find it incredulous that this is marketed as suiting sensitive skin types as well, seeing as fragrance is a known skin irritant. The fragrance is an absolute deterrent for me. This is marketed as suitable for use on the face and body. Perhaps this is better used on the body because I find it completely unsuitable for the face and particularly a dry and sensitive one. I have typically enjoyed Avene products and the remainder of the TriXera range, but this product is a negative outlier.

Reviews: I have been using this moisturiser for about 1-2 weeks now and am extremely happy with the results. Although it is called a balm (and provides a high concentration of moisture) it actually has the consistency of a milk.  This means that it spreads very well and a little goes a long way.  Considering it comes in a 400ml bottle, at a very reasonable price, I think this product is highly cost effective.  I already use other Avene products and  am very happy with my new purchase.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I was skeptical. It is water. It is not a laser. It is not a high priced cream formulated by a trendy dermatologist. What is water going to do? Golly, was I proven wrong! I have much sun damage from being a child growing up in the late 70s and early 80s in California. Sunscreen? What's that? "Pass the Ban De Soliel for the Sun" as the commercials went. In the late 80s and early 90s I was a swimmer. I discovered sunscreen, but then became a distance swimmer. You can't exactly stop and reapply sunscreen in the middle of an ocean swim or you get disqualified if you touch the boat. I was young and stupid and about sun protection. I have a lot of sun damage from being young and stupid. Now as a cancer survivor I have a few large slit scars from surgery. The one on my neck from my thyroidectomy REALLY bothers me. This water is healing my skin!!! Again, it is just the thermal mineral and prebiotic water. It is miraculous! My skepticism was proven out the window! It is healing my sun damage. It is lessening the appearance of and softening my surgical scars. It is a God send for eczema flares and otherwise irritated or angry skin. How did I make it into my mid forties never hearing or this product or using it before? If you were skeptical like me, give it a go. You'll never be more pleased you were proven wrong. This is not only a "game changer" as some over say it is a watery miracle. Now I believe the people who go to the destinations for the healing waters. I'm saving up for trip to the Avene spa myself. It is safe for we of the supersensitive skin. It is safe for we cancer patients. Check with your doctor before hand/I am not a doctor nor doling out medical advice but I would spray this on a radiation burn zebra stripe without hesitating. Same with a sun burn. It is the ONLY thing now I used during an eczema flare up or summer mosquito bite. To summarize: I'm a former skeptic now preaching this product.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: What can I say? I wish I had tried Avene sooner.The thermal water is part of my everyday routine AM and PM routine. It has been healing and help with hydration.

Reviews: It's really good for my skin. I have acn√©, and I use it after washing my face. Helps me with redness and overall calming down my acn√© a little bit. As well, gives really good hydration back into the skin.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Av√®ne Thermal Spring Water is a mist that provides soothing, softening benefits for sensitive, hypersensitive and allergic skin. Like most people, I was pretty sceptical about this and thought it was simply expensive water in can. The nozzle and pressure of the can provides a good volume of mist and coverage, and is easy to use on the face or all over the body. The thermal spring water has been refreshing and soothing, especially on days when my skin is dry, red or irritated. I have noticed that after using the spray, it provides a nice soothing feeling, calms down the redness and irritation on the skin, and a nice hydration boost before moisturising to lock that moisture. It is really easy to use, simply point the nozzle and spray, giving a bit of time and pat down to dry. This product is multipurpose and great to leave in the fridge for a cool refreshing spritz especially on a hot day or to help sooth any irritation or redness. Though it is pretty expensive to simply use as a cooling mist. I do like the soothing effects, minimising irritation and redness, as well as the hydration boost before moisturising.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Before testing this product out, I was kept sceptical. However, as someone who suffers from dry skin and eczema, I was pleasantly surprised with the results this spring water provided. It's almost an all-purpose skin spray; I used it before applying makeup and also on my dry skin. It's added hydration to my skin and is very soothing I would also say I was surprised by how big the 300mL was. I would, however, repurchase the smaller bottle just to keep in my handbag to refresh my face.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this refreshing spray! I guess it's hard to write a review and the number one thing that people wonder is "do I need this?" There are just so many uses and I particularly loved the tip of popping it in the fridge for a cold mist. I must say, I particularly loved it after a beach visit to freshen up and prevent my face going crusty or salty from the beach! I love it as a base/first step for skincare as I find products get absorbed better when there is a little premoisture/hydration. I love it to refresh my makeup-spray a little at the end of the day and you feel fresher. Dab away any extra moisture and oil and you'll look as good as new! Whilst this product isn't an "essential" like say, an SPF or moisturiser, I think it is an essential in that once you have it you'll wonder how you did without it.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product was so refreshing for the skin - I took it on a picnic and to the beach and it cooled down my skin so much. It didn't take off my sunscreen and at the end of the day my skin felt nourished and hydrated. Highly recommend!

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Refreshing and hydrating all in one relaxing mist. I've been using the thermal water in the morning before and after I work out for hydration and a little freshen up. My skin feels plump and looks dewy and fresh even after I've just rolled out of bed. I always carry the mini bottle in my handbag whenever I travel as it gives your skin that little boost it needs! I didn't see any insane effects in the texture of my skin but I still absolutely love this product for refreshing and plumping up my skin during the day. I'm so excited for summer to roll around so I can get even more use out of this mist during humid days!

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Avene Thermal Sping Water Spray is perfect for summer! It's nice and cool on the skin and super refreshing. My face feels hydrated after, but isn't sticky at all. The spray has a good pressure, is easy to control and is not overpowering. Although this product is great, I haven't noticed any differences, nor has there hasn't been any visible changes to my skin. The price of the product is reasonable, and I would purchase it again for the summer!

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lovely product that I use over the cooler months. I have this on my desk and use it all day long. The mist is fine and the nozzle sprays  well. I'm not sure if it actually does anything for my skin though? It would be difficult to see visible results. I also like to use it before I apply oil so my face is slightly damp. I mainly use it to cool down. But I don't think I would use this purely for skin care benefits

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a refreshing moisture boost, and very convenient to use. I use it through the day, after I have a cleaned my face and it does the job for me. Really good to use after you have come in from the sun! Its cooling and refreshing. It takes a while to evaporate from the skin, but one can get around that by not spraying on too much. I have combination skin that is prone to rashes. I find this product moisturizing and soothing.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: The moisturizer 's consistency is good, but something did not agree with my skin that the product never soaked into my skin , I need something more occlusive to avoid transepidermal water loss if I put too much of my face was super greasy several hours later.I had too stop using it eventually.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: This is a really nice step after cleansing and before the rest of my skincare routine, or if I need a little mid-day hydration. I also really enjoy this after using chemical exfoliants to relax my skin.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: Love the smoothing hand cream, superfood kale & turmeric. My favorite

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: This is my first time buying this product and I was super excited about it because I have been using the lotion and the cleanser for about a year now and I love it. I used the mist spray twice but the bottle top where the mist comes out broke. now when I go to spray I just get drops of liquid. Love the product but disappointed with the design of the bottle (I cant use the product anymore).

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I've been using it everyday for over a year, it's nice and refreshing, but I see absolutely no improvement in my skin. But I still use it. Maybe my skin would be worse if I did't. Who knows.

ProductName: Avene Thermal Spring Water 150ml - Mist for Sensitive skin
Reviews: I sooo wanted this to work as it has high reviews! I anxiously awaited for it to arrive as I was having and still am; a horrid flare-up of contact dermatitis. I sprayed this on and it completely did the opposite of my Hope's! My eyes got so much redder and my flare up is still on going. Every skin is different so what works wonders for one, may not work for the other
